snippet: CBS, America’s most-watched TV network, reported a better-than-expected profit as revenue from affiliates and subscription fees rose, but overall revenue fell about 2 percent.
abstract: CBS reports first-quarter net income from continuing operations of $394 million, down from $462 million in year-earlier periods; results, weighed down by NFL schedule, exceed analyst expectations.
lead_paragraph: CBS, America’s most-watched TV network, reported a better-than-expected profit as revenue from affiliates and subscription fees rose, but overall revenue fell about 2 percent.

headline.main: Profits at CBS Outperform Expectations, but N.F.L. Schedule Causes Revenue Drop
headline.print_headline: Profits at CBS Outperform Expectations, but N.F.L. Schedule Causes Revenue Drop
